page.syntax: Return_Value as A = UI_DLG_EVAL(C title,C expr)

argument.name: Return_Value
argument.description: The result of evaluating the Expression.

argument.name: title
argument.description: The Title of the modeless Xdialog box.

argument.name: expr
argument.description: Any expression that can be evaluated in the context of the Xdialog.

page.description: Return the result of an expression evaluated in the context of an xdialog.
page.discussion: The UI_DLG_EVAL() function evaluates an expression in the context of a modeless Xdialog box. The function is useful for going beyond what UI_DLG_EVENT() can offer, since there is no requirement that an event handler be coded. Limitations: Desktop applications only.

section.title: Example

section.description: This statement run in the Interactive window returns the current value of x as defined above.

section.example: fname = "Fred" lname = "Flintstone" ui_modeless_dlg_box("Me","<&Close>",<<%code% if a_dlg_button = "&Close" then a_dlg_button = "" ui_modeless_dlg_close("Me") end if %code%) function one as C() one = "I am the one" end function

section.description: Go to the Interactive window. You can now execute arbitrary expressions in the Xdialog's context..
section.example: ? ui_dlg_eval("Me","One()") = "I am the one" ? ui_dlg_eval("Me","fname") = "Fred" ? ui_dlg_eval("Me","local_variables()") = fname = "Fred" lname = "Flintstone"

see.ref: Reading Variables in External Modeless Xdialogs
